Package net.demilich.metastone.game.spells.trigger

Interface Trigger

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AttributeAura, Aura, BuffAura, BuffEnchantment, CaptnCookieAura, CardAura, CardCostInsteadAura, CardCostModifier, ChooseOneOverrideAura, DoubleBattlecriesAura, DoubleCombosAura, DoubleDeathrattlesAura, Enchantment, EnrageAura, HeroPowerBonusAura, NoggenfoggerAura, OneTurnCostModifier, PhysicalAttackTargetOverrideAura, Quest, Secret, SpecificCardFilterOverrideAura, SpellOverrideAura, SpellTargetsAdjacentAura, SupremaciesTriggerTwiceAura, SupremacyBonusEffectAura, TargetSelectionOverrideAura, ToggleCostModifier
    public interface Trigger
extends java.io.Serializable
    Triggers respond to GameEvent objects that are raised by various GameLogic methods, implementing cards that do something when something else happens.
    See Also:
    for an implementation that casts a spell when an event is raised. Most trigger effects behave like this., for how the fields in this interface are used.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canFire​(GameEvent event)
      Checks if a trigger can fire in response to a specific event.
      default boolean canFireCondition​(GameEvent event)
      Returns true if the trigger can fire in response to the given GameEvent given a possible Condition
      Trigger clone()
      Clones the trigger with any internal state.
      void expire()
      Expires the trigger; marks it for removal and prevents it from executing in the future.
      EntityReference getHostReference()
      Gets a reference to the Entity that is "hosting," or owning, the trigger.
      int getOwner()
      Gets the player who owns this trigger.
      boolean hasPersistentOwner()
      Indicates this trigger cannot change owners.
      boolean interestedIn​(GameEventType eventType)
      Returns true if this trigger is a listener for the given GameEventType.
      boolean isExpired()
      Checks if, due to the execution of possibly complex rules inside or outside the trigger, the trigger is expired (no longer should fire).
      void onAdd​(GameContext context)
      Called when the trigger is added into a GameContext's state.
      boolean oneTurnOnly()
      Indicates this trigger is only active for the current turn, then it should expire().
      void onGameEvent​(GameEvent event)
      Handles an event this trigger canFire(GameEvent) for and is interestedIn(GameEventType).
      void onRemove​(GameContext context)
      Called when the trigger is removed from the given game context.
      void setHost​(Entity host)
      Sets or changes the Entity that is the owner / host of this trigger.
      void setOwner​(int playerIndex)
      Sets the player who is the owner of this trigger.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Trigger clone()
        Clones the trigger with any internal state.
        Returns:
        A clone of this trigger.

      • canFire

        boolean canFire​(GameEvent event)
        Checks if a trigger can fire in response to a specific event.
        Parameters:
        event - A game event.
        Returns:
        true if the trigger can fire in response to this event.

      • getHostReference

        EntityReference getHostReference()
        Gets a reference to the Entity that is "hosting," or owning, the trigger.
        Returns:
        An entity reference. This is typically not null.

      • getOwner

        int getOwner()
        Gets the player who owns this trigger.
        Returns:
        GameContext.PLAYER_1 or GameContext.PLAYER_2.

      • interestedIn

        boolean interestedIn​(GameEventType eventType)
        Returns true if this trigger is a listener for the given GameEventType.
        Parameters:
        eventType - The event type.
        Returns:
        true if this trigger wants its onGameEvent(GameEvent) method called whenever it canFire(GameEvent) to the specified eventType.

      • isExpired

        boolean isExpired()
        Checks if, due to the execution of possibly complex rules inside or outside the trigger, the trigger is expired (no longer should fire).
        Returns:
        true if the trigger should be removed and will no longer fire.

      • onAdd

        void onAdd​(GameContext context)
        Called when the trigger is added into a GameContext's state.
        Parameters:
        context - The game context.

      • onGameEvent

        @Suspendable
void onGameEvent​(GameEvent event)
        Handles an event this trigger canFire(GameEvent) for and is interestedIn(GameEventType).
        Parameters:
        event - The game event this trigger is now processing.

      • onRemove

        @Suspendable
void onRemove​(GameContext context)
        Called when the trigger is removed from the given game context.
        Parameters:
        context - The game context.

      • setHost

        void setHost​(Entity host)
        Sets or changes the Entity that is the owner / host of this trigger.
        Parameters:
        host - The host Entity/

      • setOwner

        void setOwner​(int playerIndex)
        Sets the player who is the owner of this trigger.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - GameContext.PLAYER_1 or GameContext.PLAYER_2.

      • hasPersistentOwner

        boolean hasPersistentOwner()
        Indicates this trigger cannot change owners. For example, a Secret does not have a persistent owner, because card texts can steal secrets. However, the trigger described by Blessing of Wisdom does have a persistent owner, since the casting player of that spell should always draw the card it receives.
        Returns:
        true if the trigger's onGameEvent(GameEvent) should be evaluated from the point of view of the owner when the trigger was created, as opposed to what the owner is right now (which may have changed).

      • oneTurnOnly

        boolean oneTurnOnly()
        Indicates this trigger is only active for the current turn, then it should expire().
        Returns:
        true if this is a one-turn long trigger.

      • expire

        void expire()
        Expires the trigger; marks it for removal and prevents it from executing in the future.

      • canFireCondition

        default boolean canFireCondition​(GameEvent event)
        Returns true if the trigger can fire in response to the given GameEvent given a possible Condition
        Parameters:
        event - The currently raised event.
        Returns:
        true if the trigger can fire.
